Posts.Title: Dana Farber vs MGH? TectonicShift Lulu22

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2012 02:21PM Lulu22 wrote: I found mine last December and immediately went in for a mammogram. Unfortunately the radiologist read my repeat mammo as a fibroadenoma and sent me home assuring me I was fine and didn't need to return for a year. When I had my annual checkup in February my PCP seemed comfortable with the diagnosis. Over the summer the lump got bigger and I finally went to my PCP to demand answers and/or treatment options and she sent me back for testing. I got the BC dx on my kids' first day of school. On the initial ultrasound my tumor measured at 4-5 cm. but my MO, BS and I all agree that by the time I started neoadjuvant chemo a couple of weeks later it was at least 6 cm.. I just finished my last chemo (4 AC + 4 Taxol) two days ago (yeah!) and the tumor is definitely smaller and further from the skin than it was so my chances of getting off with a lumpectomy have improved considerably.
Posts.Title: Calling All with Tumors 6 cm + J-Bug CaliKelly

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2011 03:26PM Lulu22 wrote: When I did my bloodwork for today's AC my HGB was low and I was told if it dropped any more I'd need an infusion. The question I forgot to ask was, does the infusion need to be done before the next round of chemo or can it be done post-chemo? IOW, would the need for an infusion delay my next treatment or could we keep on schedule? (My center does bookwork and chemo on the same day.) Anyone have experience with this?

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 01:44AM Lulu22 wrote: Burton Goldberg, according to his web site is a publisher and "self-made businessman". He "is not a physician, so he cannot replace the guidance that your physician may be offering." His initial consultation, which is not covered by insurance, costs $250.  The funny thing is that Goldberg's regimen, like Burzynski's, includes low dose chemo. Other than reducing (not eliminating) side effects, how is this substantially different from conventional therapies?  www.burtongoldberg.com/biograp...
